title: 113_hr1578
content: Extension of funding for reopening enrollment under the Preexisting Condition Insurance Program. Extension of funding for reopening enrollment under the Preexisting Condition Insurance Program. The Secretary of Health and Human Services will resume accepting applications for the temporary high-risk health insurance program, with an additional $2.8 billion appropriated for claims and administrative costs. No changes will affect the termination of authority under the program. SEC. 2. Immediate access to health care for sick Americans is amended to apply to individuals applying for coverage through the high-risk insurance pool program. SEC. 3. Increase in excise tax on cigarettes. Section 5701(b)(1) of the Internal Revenue Code is amended to increase the tax on cigarettes to $52.33 per thousand for those removed after December 31, 2013, and before January 1, 2024. A floor stocks tax is imposed on cigarettes held for sale before January 1, 2014, at a rate exceeding the prior tax imposed on the same article. The Internal Revenue Code is amended to increase the tax on cigarettes to $52.33 per thousand for those removed after December 31, 2013, and before January 1, 2024. A credit of $500 is allowed against the taxes imposed, with liability for tax and method of payment specified. The tax imposed must be paid on or before May 1, 2014. The tax imposed on articles in foreign trade zones on July 1, 2013, shall be paid by May 1, 2014, regardless of internal revenue taxes or customs duties determined before that date. Security under the 2d proviso of section 3(a) includes definitions and rules similar to section 5702 of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986. The term "Secretary" refers to the Secretary of the Treasury. Controlled groups follow rules similar to section 5061(e)(3) of the Code. All applicable laws and penalties related to taxes imposed by section 5701 of the Code apply here. The amendments made by this section apply to floor stocks taxes imposed by paragraph (1) as if imposed by section 5701. The Secretary may allow a credit or refund to the person who bore the tax burden. Effective December 31, 2013, the amendments apply to articles removed as defined in section 5702(j) of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986.
